title: Accessing Team List via 'Teams' cell within the More section
custom_preconds: Given the user is in the More section of the app
custom_steps: When the user taps the Teams button
custom_expected: The user is taken to the list of teams listed in alphabetical order with the favorites listed at the top

title: Tapping on a team in the Teams list opens the Team page
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the teams list page
custom_steps: When the user taps the name of a given team
custom_expected: Then the team page for that team is opened

title: Tapping on team logo after setting a favorite team
custom_preconds: Given the user has set a favorite team
custom_steps: When the user taps the team's logo in the top of the main menu
custom_expected: Then the user will be brought to the Team page for the selected team

title: Page colors match team colors
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in the Main Nav
And selects Teams
custom_steps:
When the user selects a team
AND is taken to the team clubhouse page
custom_expected: Then the user will see that all page colors match the team colors for the chosen team

title: Team logo is correct
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in the Main Nav
And selects Teams
custom_steps:
When the user selects a team
AND is taken to the team clubhouse page

*Note: the letters for the logo for the Jackson Generals is white
custom_expected: Then the user will see the correct team logo on the clubhouse page

title: MLB Affiliate name is correct
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in the Main Nav
And selects Teams
custom_steps:
When the user selects a Team
AND is taken to the team clubhouse page
custom_expected: Then the user will see a bar with the correct MLB Affiliate underneath the team city and name

title: MiLB class information is correct
custom_preconds:
Given the navigates to Main Nav
And selects Teams
custom_steps:
When the user selects a team
AND is taken to the team clubhouse page
custom_expected: Then the user will see the correct MiLB Class information for selected team

title: Top section shows previous, current and next games on main screen
custom_preconds:
*This might need to be changed for Android as the team page in Android At Bat only uses a 3 day range due to performance issues. Marking incomplete for now until further details come in.

Given the user is on a Teams list
custom_steps: When the user taps a team name
custom_expected: The team page is opened and the user can see the list of three games, shows previous, current, and next games on main screen with the current date's game selected.

title: Games on the team page
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the team page
custom_steps: When the user swipes left or right on the scores at the top of the page
custom_expected: Then the user is able to swipe through all three games on the team page

title: Date navigation works for schedule
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the team clubhouse page
custom_steps: When the user selects a date in the navigation bar
custom_expected: Then the user is taken to the selected date

title: Check all time zones
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the team page
And the device is set to a non-EST Time zone (eg. PST)

NOTE: especially check west coast teams with post-10pm start times with device set to Pacific time
custom_steps:
When a game is selected from the list at the top of the page 
And that game time is past 10pm EST
custom_expected: Then it should appear correctly with the correct time zone and game time listed. (Test for EST, CST, MST, PST)

title: Teams page updates immediately when returning from Background > Foreground
custom_preconds:
Given the app is installed
And the user was last on a Team page
And the app is running but backgrounded
custom_steps: When the user brings the app to the foreground
custom_expected:
Then the app should remain on the Team page
And the app should immediately update and refresh data

title: Preview
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the team page
custom_steps: When a game is in preview
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the following:
- Gameday button
- Tickets button

title: Preview - Gameday
custom_preconds: Given user is on the team page and in Preview state
custom_steps: When the user taps on the Gameday button
custom_expected: The user will be taken to the corresponding Gameday with the Preview, Matchup and Lineup tabs

title: Preview - Tickets
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the team page and in Preview
custom_steps: When the user taps on the Tickets button
custom_expected:
Then the user should be taken to the corresponding MiLB.com Ballpark Ticketing landing page of the selected team,

i.e. If on the Baysox team page should be taken to http://m.milb.com/t418/ballpark

title: Manage Purchase Tickets Link for Tulsa_MIAN-601
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the team page for Tulsa
custom_steps: When the user views the links
custom_expected:
Then there is a with text "Manage Ticket Purchases" placed below Tickets link (3rd item in the list)
https://td1.glitnirticketing.com/tdticket/web/wportal.php

title: Ad is showing up properly
custom_preconds:
Given the user navigates to Main Nav
And selects Teams
custom_steps:
When the user selects a team
AND is taken to the team clubhouse page
custom_expected: Then the user will see a properly formatted ad at the bottom of the page

title: Back button goes back to Teams page
custom_preconds: Given the user is on a team clubhouse page
custom_steps: When the user selects the back button
custom_expected: Then the user will be back on the teams index page

title: Team records only show up in the main section for today's game and previously completed games
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the team page
custom_steps:
When a game appears in the main section 
AND
has been completed 
OR 
is scheduled
custom_expected: Then

custom_steps_separated.content: If the game is in preview state
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the team records appear under the team logos

custom_steps_separated.content: If the game is in live (in progress)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the team records should NOT appear

custom_steps_separated.content: If the game is in final state
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the team records appear next to the team name in the linescore

title: Navigating to previous or next games will update the main section to that dates game
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the team page
custom_steps: When the user navigates to a past or future game from the three games list at the top of the page
custom_expected: The main view will be updated to reflect the information for that game selected

title: Preview game, Main section shows preview if game has not yet gone into warmups
custom_preconds: Given the user is on a Team page
custom_steps: When the user selects a game that has not yet gone into warmups from the scores at the top of the page
custom_expected: Then they will see the game preview information for the selected game in the main view

title: Live game, Main section shows linescore if game is in progress
custom_preconds: Given the user is on a Team page
custom_steps: When the user selects a game that is in progress from the scores at the top of the page
custom_expected:
Then they will see the linescore, 
And below the linescore the pitcher name & stats, and batter name & stats information for the selected game in the main view

title: Live game, home team is below the away team in the line score
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the team page
custom_steps: When the user selects a game that is in progress
custom_expected: The selected game appears in the main section and the home team should appear BELOW the away team in the linescore

title: Live game, the main section refreshes according to the refresh rate in settings
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the team page
And there is an active game visible in the main section
custom_steps: When the game is ongoing or being strung
custom_expected: Then the linescore, count and bases information should update accoring to the refresh rate in settings.

title: Live game, Check Gameday buttons opens Gameday Live tab for appropriate game
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the Team page
And a game is available/live
custom_steps: When the user taps the Gameday buttons underneath the game information
custom_expected: Then the user is taken to that game's corresponding section of Gameday where Gameday takes user to the Live tab

title: Live game, Check Box Score button opens Gameday Boxscore for appropriate game
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the Team page
And a game is available/live
custom_steps: When the user taps the Boxscore buttons underneath the game information
custom_expected: Then the user is taken to that game's corresponding section of Gameday where Boxscore takes the user to the Box tab

title: Final game, Main section shows linescore
custom_preconds: Given the user is on a Team page
custom_steps: When the user selects a game that has gone final from the scores at the top of the page
custom_expected: Then they will see the linescore and pitching stats information for the selected game in the main view

title: Final game, home team is below the away team in the line score
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the team page
custom_steps: When the user selects a game that is in progress or has been completed
custom_expected: The selected game appears in the main section and the home team should appear BELOW the away team in the linescore

title: Final game that went to extra innings, user is able to scroll to all innings in the line score
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on a Team page
And there is a game that took more than 9 innings to complete
And that game is selected and visible in the main view
custom_steps: When the user tries to scroll on the linescore
custom_expected: Then the linescore should scroll left and right so the user can see the linescore for all the innings that were played

title: Final game, Wrap button works properly
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the team clubhouse page
custom_steps: When the user selects the wrap button
custom_expected: Then the user will be taken to the correct wrap up page

title: Final game, Box score button works properly
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the team clubhouse page
custom_steps: When the user selects the box score button
custom_expected: Then the user will be taken to the corresponding box score page for the game that was selected

title: Delayed, suspended, cancelled, and postponed games are indicated appropriately in the main section
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the team page
And there is a selected game visible in the main section

custom_steps_separated.content: When that particular game state is set to Delayed
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user game state will be correctly reflected in the main section view

custom_steps_separated.content: When that particular game state is set to Suspended
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user game state will be correctly reflected in the main section view

custom_steps_separated.content: When that particular game state is set to Postponed
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user game state will be correctly reflected in the main section view

custom_steps_separated.content: When that particular game state is set to Cancelled
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user game state will be correctly reflected in the main section view

title: Toggle between Calendar and List Schedule View
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the team clubhouse page and taps Schedule and Results
custom_steps: When the user switches between calendar and list schedule view
custom_expected: Then the calendar will switch properly

title: Navigation arrows exist on Calendar View
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the team clubhouse page and taps Schedule and Results
custom_steps: When the user is on the Calendar view
custom_expected: Then they will be able to see and use navigation arrows to go to previous and future months

title: Previous games are clickable
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the team clubhouse page and taps Schedule and Results
custom_steps: When the user selects a previous game
custom_expected: Then the user will be taken the specific wrap for that game

title: Back button exists to return to Clubhouse page
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the team clubhouse page
And the user navigates to Schedule and Results page
custom_steps: When the user selects the back button
custom_expected: Then the user will be sent back to the clubhouse page

Select Schedule & Results
custom_steps: When the user select a random day of any month from the Calendar that the team is playing and/or has played.

custom_steps: When the user taps on the matchup pop-up

title: Toggle between Name and Position view
custom_preconds:

custom_steps: When the user toggles between Name and Position
custom_expected: Then the user will see a properly formatted roster based on what is selected

title: Back button exists to return to Clubhouse page
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the team clubhouse page
And the user selects roster
custom_steps: When the user selects the back button
custom_expected: Then the user will be taken back to the clubhouse page

title: Positions and Numbers are shown properly
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the team clubhouse page
And the user selects roster
custom_steps: When the user checks the roster for positions and numbers
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the correct numbers and position for each player

* Note: If Infield Noted player is listed (position appears as "Infielder") then the positions should appear as follows: Catcher, First Base, Second Base, Third Base, Shortstop, Infielder

title: Check that Roster opens corresponding team's roster
custom_preconds: Given the user is on a Team page
custom_steps: When the user taps the Roster button
custom_expected: Then the Roster page for a appropriate team appears

title: Name section players are in alphabetical order by last name
custom_preconds: Given the Roster page in the Team section
custom_steps: When the user selects the Name tab
custom_expected: Then the players listed should appear in alphabetical order

title: Tapping on player should open player cards
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the roster page for a team
custom_steps: When the user taps on a player's name
custom_expected: Then the player card opens and the information should fit correctly on the screen without issues.

title: Position section players are grouped by position
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the Roster page in the Team section
custom_steps: When the user selects the Position tab
custom_expected: Then the players should be grouped by position and then in alphabetical order of name within each position group

title: All news items can be selected
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the team clubhouse page
And the user has selected news
custom_steps: When the user selects a news item
custom_expected:
Then the user will be taken to the correct article 

*Note: Some articles will not have blurbs, clubs are responsible for adding their own blurbs. We're not going to be able to ensure that all clubs have them. As long as the data that is there is showing, this is fine.

title: Back button exists to return to Clubhouse page
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the team clubhouse page
And the user has selected news
custom_steps: When the user selects the back button
custom_expected: Then the user will be taken back to the clubhouse index page

title: Check the appropriate team news shows up
custom_preconds: Given the user is on a Team page
custom_steps: When the user taps the News button
custom_expected: Then the user is taken to the news index for the given team and news items specific to that team appear

title: Accuracy and screen fit of articles/images (should show a default image for missing images)
custom_preconds: Given the user is on a Team page
custom_steps: When the user taps the Latest News button
custom_expected:
Then they are taken to the News index and articles and images should fit correctly within the index
And if an image does not appear, a default placeholder image should appear in its place

title: Favorite Team Page's Settings Button
custom_preconds:
Given the user has selected a team page
And views the Settings button on each team page
custom_steps: When the user selects the Settings button on their favorite Team Page
custom_expected:
Then the user should be taken directly to that team's specific push notifications settings
tray expanded. All other teams notification trays will be "collapsed" or hidden from the user

title: Team's Push Notification Settings
custom_preconds:
Given the user has selected a team page
And views the Settings button on each team page
custom_steps: When the user is on the team's push notifications settings (check all teams)
custom_expected: Then the user will have the ability to enable/disable their notification settings (check all teams pages).

title: Toggling On Notifications
custom_preconds:
Given the user has selected a team page
And views the Settings button on each team page
custom_steps: When the user has toggled on certain or all notifications (test both)
custom_expected: Then the user will receive the corresponding notifications

title: Toggling Off Notifications
custom_preconds:
Given the user has selected a team page
And views the Settings button on each team page
custom_steps: When the user has toggled off certain or all notifications (test both)
custom_expected: Then the user will not receive the notifications

title: MiLB In the Park
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the team page
custom_steps: When the user taps on MiLB In the Park
custom_expected:
Then if the is installed the user will be taken to the app
if the app is not installed the user will be taken to the Google Play store to download the app

title: Test List/Calendar buttons and team matchups are correct
custom_preconds:
From main slide out menu, select Teams
Select any Team
Select Schedule & Results

custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the List view of the games is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user select a random day of any month that the team is playing and/or has played.
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user is taken to the corresponding Gameday
Then the Calendar view of the games is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user select a random day of any month from the Calendar that the team is playing and/or has played.
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a pop-up will display with the matchup of the corresponding game selected

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the matchup pop-up
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user is taken to the corresponding Gameday

title: Push Notifications
custom_preconds:
Given the user has selected a team page
And views the Settings button on each team page
custom_steps: When the user has selected a team page
custom_expected: Then the user should view the Settings button on each team page

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user selects the Settings button on their favorite Team Page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should be taken directly to that team's specific push notifications settings
tray expanded.  All other teams notification trays will be "collapsed" or hidden from the user

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is on the team's push notifications settings (check all teams)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will have the ability to enable/disable their notification settings (check all teams pages).

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user has toggled on certain or all notifications (test both)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will receive the corresponding notifications

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user has toggled off certain or all notifications (test both)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will not receive the notifications
